title: IB Physics - Thermal Physics
subject: physics
description: Quiz covering temperature, internal energy, specific heat, ideal gases, and thermodynamics for IB Physics
author: OpenNotes

questions.question: How much energy (in kJ) is needed to heat $2$ kg of water from $20째C$ to $80째C$? Specific heat capacity of water $= 4200 \text{ J kg}^{-1}\text{K}^{-1}$.
According to the kinetic theory, the average kinetic energy of gas molecules is proportional to:
questions.explanation: $\bar{E_k} = \frac{3}{2}k_BT$. Average kinetic energy is directly proportional to absolute temperature in kelvin.

questions.question: An ideal gas at $300$ K and $100$ kPa is compressed to half its volume at constant temperature. The new pressure is:
questions.explanation: Boyle's Law: $P_1V_1 = P_2V_2$. $100 \times V = P_2 \times \frac{V}{2}$. $P_2 = 200$ kPa

questions.question: During an isothermal expansion of an ideal gas:
options: Internal energy stays constant, heat equals work done by gas
Both temperature and pressure remain constant
questions.explanation: Isothermal means constant T, so $\Delta U = 0$ (internal energy depends only on T for ideal gas). By first law: $Q = W$.

questions.question: Find the number of moles in $3.01 \times 10^{23}$ molecules of $O_2$. ($N_A = 6.02 \times 10^{23}$)
Specific latent heat of vaporization is the energy needed to:
options: Change 1 kg of liquid to gas at constant temperature
Change 1 kg of solid to liquid at constant temperature
Raise 1 kg of liquid by 1 K
Change all liquid to gas at constant temperature
questions.explanation: Specific latent heat of vaporization = energy per unit mass to change state from liquid to gas at constant temperature.

questions.question: Using $pV = nRT$, calculate the volume of 1 mol of ideal gas at STP ($T = 273$ K, $P = 101.3$ kPa, $R = 8.31 \text{ J mol}^{-1}\text{K}^{-1}$):
In an adiabatic process:
questions.explanation: Adiabatic means no heat transfer ($Q = 0$). By the first law: $\Delta U = Q - W = -W$. Work done by gas decreases internal energy.

questions.question: The internal energy of an ideal gas depends on:
questions.explanation: For an ideal gas, internal energy is purely kinetic and depends only on temperature: $U = \frac{3}{2}nRT$
